intro: Kochia fimbriolata, commonly known as the fringed kochia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery bracts that give it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairie and steppe habitats. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Kochia fimbriolata is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy plant in xeriscaped gardens.
